attributes.action: Debate whether Private finance initiative should be outlawed for local councils
attributes.background:
should there be a national debate whether Private finance initiative should be outlawed for local councils?
Prof Allyson Pollock, said “are consistently higher than public borrowing costs”. 
Barts Health NHS Trust will pay £7 billion for a hospital which cost £1.1 billion
attributes.additional_details:
Barts Health rebuild cost £1.1 billion but, the final cost will be more than £7 billion with the Barts Health NHS Trust making payments until 2049. 
PFI deals will cost taxpayers £209bn over next 35 years.

attributes.action: Make the long term tethering of ponies illegal
attributes.background: There are many ponies tethered for days on end on grass verges,even roundabouts in towns such as Harlow, where there is little in the way of shelter from the excesses of weather,hot or cold and are often are deprived of water to drink.

attributes.action: Give users of mobile phones while driving a 3 month driving ban.
attributes.background: Every day I walk my dogs I see many drivers using their mobile phones. Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving.
attributes.additional_details: I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive. Before I retired it would have been very difficult for me to get to work without my car as no public transport was available. If others were put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone, hopefully!

attributes.action: Fund programme for more public information about when to call for an ambulance
attributes.background: The amount of unnecessary or non life threatening calls that are made to emergency services in particular the ambulance service is too high. There needs to be some form of public communication clearly stating when to dial 999. I.e. televised adverts
attributes.additional_details: This christmas period alone in the east anglian and north east areas of the country received 10,000 phone calls. This is too great a number for the ambulance services to cope with. There will be a high percentage of those calls would not have been life threating. The general public need to be made aware when it is acceptable to dial 999, this would ease pressure for staff when faced with real emergencies. Maybe in the form of televised adverts at peak tines when adults and children will see them

attributes.action: Make it the law for all public places with toilets to have baby change table
attributes.background:
Visited a Subway Restaurant and was surprised to find no where available to change my babies nappy. So I had to change him on a sofa in the restaurant.
After some researching, I have found that public places legally DO NOT have to supply a baby change facility.
attributes.additional_details:
I think this is completely wrong. It's not appropriate to change a baby on a dirty toilet floor or in a public open space as you dont know whose around. This needs to change.
Please help get this law changed. So that all public toilets have to have a changing table available.
Thank you for you support

attributes.action: Increase the National Minimum Wage to £10 per hour.
attributes.background: The National Minimum wage in the UK needs an immediate increase to £10 per hour to provide an acceptable living standard for hardworking people. The government has re-branded NMW as 'Living Wage' and this is wrong as the Living Wage Foundation states it should be £8.75 for UK and £10.20 for London.
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of living is rising year on year and the nation needs to be rewarded for our hard work. £10 an hour isn't for holidays and lavish spending, it is to cover basic living costs. The UK economy would benefit from extra tax receipts and increased manufacturing output as people could spend more.
In a time when MP's earn £74,962 basic pay and claim expenses on top and a worker on Minimum Wage averages £13500 before tax and has to pay for work expenses is it too much to ask for £10 per hour?

attributes.action: Teach LGBTQ sexual education in schools and about other sexuality's.
attributes.background: Within schools teaching LGBTQ sexual education is not on the curriculum, leaving those who are homosexual without the correct education that they need to have healthy and positive sexual experiences, with many contracting diseases. The spectrum of sexuality's are also left open for stereotyping.
attributes.additional_details:
The GLSEN 2013 National School Climate Survey found that fewer than five percent of LGBT students had health classes that included positive representations of LGBTQ topics.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-33237995-for facts on sexually transmitted diseases for men

https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/a-to-z/s/sexuality-for how mental health affects those on the spectrum.

attributes.action: Stop all anonymous telephone calls and ban virtual telephone numbers.
attributes.background:
Householders across the UK are plagued by unsolicited telephone calls, which are increasingly automated. The majority of these calls arise from either with-held numbers or virtual numbers. 
The Government should make it illegal for Telephone Service Providers to pass on such telephone calls.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a simple matter for telephone service providers to identify both of these types of call and to prevent them from being put through to households; indeed, some companies will do this, at a price; effectively colluding with the "cold callers" to increase telephone service provider profits.
It is difficult to imagine a legal need for anyone to with-hold their telephone number or to pretend that they are calling from somewhere else, both of which actions are a deception.

attributes.action: Increase the age limit to 25 to buy alcohol.
attributes.background: On February 15th 2018 my little brother lost his life aged only 27 years old. He was an alcoholic and fought ferociously to overcome his addiction. I work in retail and I have to challenge anyone who appears to be under 25. So why not just make it legal to be 25 or older??

attributes.action: Repeal the ‘Licensing Act 2003’ and restore the ‘Licensing Act 1921’
attributes.background: Binge drinking has become a huge cultural problem in the UK in our towns and cities. People’s selfish behaviour accounts for 12 - 15% of attendances at emergency departments due to acute alcohol intoxication. This peaks to about 70% on Friday, Saturday nights, Christmas Eve and New Years Eve.
attributes.additional_details: Return to older licensing laws where “on” and “off” premises sales of alcohol be restricted to 9 hours in the metropolis, 8 and a half hours elsewhere and 5 hours on sundays and bank holidays. The “Licensing Act 1921” requires a two hour interval and opening hours were 11am - 11pm in London and 11am - 10pm elsewhere. This will create a culture change and reverse some of the ill effects of the liberalisation of the licensing act in 1988.

attributes.action: HM Ships Albion, Bulwark to be funded by the foreign aid budget.
attributes.background: UK defense cuts include removal of these ships and crews. This will result in loss of jobs and the UK being unable to respond to disasters such as recent events in the Caribbean and the Far East. They should be fully crewed and retained as part of the MOD resources paid via our foreign aid budget.
attributes.additional_details: These ships have the capability of transporting and helping rebuild Infrastructure around the world in conjunction with UK business. They should fly our flag and project UK businesses and innovations. This would also give valuable experience for our troops in wining hearts and minds. Assisting other Nations and would give a positive image of our Military. This would also show the tax paying public that our foreign aid budget is being used in a more positive way. It could also promote UK trade.

attributes.action: Build a third road coming out of  Canvey Island
attributes.background: Canvey traffic every morning and evening is ridiculous and it effects people on a day to day basis, if ever there was a major accident on the island it has been made evident by road closures it would cause chaos and hours of delays . Sign this petition to help save the island

attributes.action: Cancel Trump's proposed State Visit unless he publicly condemns Britain First.
attributes.background: President Trump has broadcast racist material produced by Britain First to his 43 million Twitter followers. This has rightly been condemned by the leaders of all mainstream UK parties, but I believe that does not go far enough to convey the strength of disgust felt across the spectrum of society.

attributes.action: Health care workers to have deaf awareness training/learn basic sign language
attributes.background: Deaf means deaf! Not hard of hearing! To often in hospital people who are deaf are treated as if they are hard of hearing/ hearing impaired.
attributes.additional_details: They are faced with healthcare professionals shouting from the end of the bed and missing out on vital decisions which are made due to poor and ineffective communication. This needs to stop, basic awareness should be incorporated in there training e.g. Writing down for the individual and confirmation of understanding. Not just relying on ineffective lip reading and poor hand gestures

attributes.action: Publish all the rights of looked after children in one simple document.
attributes.background: Looked after children can be severely affected by discrimination, even though they have legal rights to protect them. These rights need to be published in one place to make it easy for those affected and social services to find so that they can be better enforced.
attributes.additional_details: The rights of looked after children are split between the Equality Act, the Children Act 1989, the Adoption and Children Act 2002, and the Children the Families Act 2015.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against dyslexic people illegal
attributes.background: I have Dyslexia. I went for an interview and was told that they wouldn't have me because it takes me too long to learn in a role because of my Dyslexia, even though I had the knowledge and could do the role with ease.
attributes.additional_details: If Dyslexia was a named as a disability then employers would know that they had to provide reasonable adjustments, such as extra time in training or learning a new job.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty in the UK
attributes.background: Is it fair and just that someone who takes a life and is of sound body and mind is allowed to carry on living albeit incarcerated in one of HM prisons, and in due time being released by nature of serving their sentence or early parole .
attributes.additional_details: If the death Penalty was to be reintroduced in the UK. it would surely bring down knife and gun crime and make people think twice before committing premeditated or random attacks on innocent members of the public

attributes.action: Make rail companies guarantee a guard or security person is on every train.
attributes.background: Merseyrail is to introduce new Driver-Only Operated trains. They only guarantee to have a second person on trains after 8 pm. Many antisocial and criminal incidents take place at other times of day. Trains should have a second person patrolling to maintain order, check tickets and help passengers.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014, Merseyrail spokeswoman Alice Owen said: “The safety of passengers is Merseyrail’s absolute priority,..." (reported in Liverpool Echo). This cannot be achieved without personnel on trains to ensure passenger safety.

If a passenger operates the alarm handle, there needs to be someone available to render assistance. The driver cannot do this. Without a second person on the train, the driver would have to go to the next station before stopping the train. This could make matters worse.

attributes.action: Establish a Royal Commission to consider a reformed National Health Service.
attributes.background: Our NHS is 70 years old. Any institution of that age needs a review. The time has come to take the future of the NHS in hand and find a non-political solution to its future. This is not just about money, but structure.

attributes.action: Commit to increasing the size of the Royal Navy by at least 20% over 50 years
attributes.background: Historically, the Royal Navy was the best in the world. Now, it's barely in the top ten. We need to be secure, it's not a luxury but a requirement. While the existing fleet is well equipped, there aren't enough ships to be everywhere needed. 20% in 50 years isn't a huge increase, but it's a start.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Navy currently has under eighty commissioned ships. Only 3/4 of those are operational at any one time. These numbers are too small, especially compared to the 430 ships of the US Navy or the nearly 500 ships of China. In 1945 at the end of the Second World War, the Royal Navy had 900 ships, today's navy is less than 1% the size of then. We don't need to increase back to wartime levels, but we do need to increase the Navy's size considerably.

attributes.action: Increase paternity leave so it is 3 months off on full pay.
attributes.background:
I would like to propose a change to the law regarding paternity leave. I think that the current law is determinal to parents and should be altered to support working families.
I feel that fathers should get 3 months paternity leave at full pay, with an option of a further 3 months at part pay.
attributes.additional_details:
The changes would also include kit days.
Extended leave would benefit:
1. Mums recovery. The minimum recovery time for a c section is 6 weeks. If dads were off for the 3 month period they would be able to support. 
2. Sleep deprevation - babies sleep is irregular in the first 3 months. There is lots of research on sleep deprevation and its negative impact in the workplace. 
3. Dad bonding - research suggests children with good paternal bonds are often better off later in life.

attributes.action: Stop the introduction of accountable care organisations in the UK.
attributes.background:
In April 2018, Jeremy Hunt aims to establish the first accountable care organisations (ACOs). ACOs will hold multibillion-pound budgets to deliver combined health & social care for large geographical areas.
ACOs will be non-NHS entities.
The NHS was created as a public service & must remain so
attributes.additional_details: Margaret Greenwood has already raised the issue of increased scrutiny on ACOs in parliament and the lack of time for this scrutiny but given the current state of the NHS we must not allow the government to sell it off.

attributes.action: Moped riders must have a full license. Not a provisional one.
attributes.background: Recently the number of mopeds thefts on main streets has increased drastically. This is primarily caused by teenagers on mopeds snatching phones while riding. This is enhanced by the fact that to get a moped you only need to have a provisional license which is exceedingly easy to obtain.
attributes.additional_details: The number of thefts in London has skyrocketed in recent years. Within the twelve months leading up to June 2017 the metropolitan police recorded 16,158 thefts on mopeds alone. The majority of these thefts is by teenagers with learner plates; who require no experience or background checks before being able to ride. We propose that all people wishing to obtain a moped require a full license.

attributes.action: Make measuring & public reporting of emissions by companies compulsory
attributes.background: Urgent action is needed to fight climate change (UN). Air pollution is responsible for 1 in 8 deaths worldwide (WHO). By making it compulsory for companies with a 500k£+ turnover to measure & report publicly reductions in their emissions we will progress much sooner towards meeting UN SDG Goal 13.
attributes.additional_details:
1) "Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts" United Nations Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 13 (http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/climate-change-2/)
2) "Air polution causes 1 in 8 dealths. If is the single biggest environmental crisis we face" World Health Organization (http://www.who.int/sustainable-development/news-events/breath-life/en/)

attributes.action: Cancel future cuts to the public health grant and return funding cut since 2015
attributes.background:
The public health grant funds prevention work through local authority public health departments to improve the health and well being of individuals and communities
Local authorities face a £331 million reduction to their public health budget, on top of a £200 million reduction announced in 2015.
attributes.additional_details:
*Every £1 spent on public health in UK saves an average of £14.
* cuts to the public health grant hinder preventative and health promotion work.
* Preventative programmes are essential to helping in levels of obesity and dental decay in children, increasing levels of exercise and  improving mental health and well being 
Past success in for example, reducing levels of smoking and teenage pregnancy show that it can work if resourced properly

attributes.action: Ban smacking of children in England
attributes.background: Scotland and Wales are considering banning corporal punishment of children by their parents. Scientific evidence shows that smacking children is damaging. This form of discipline should no longer be legally allowed in England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/parenting/new-study-reveals-long-term-impacts-of-smacking-children/news-story/1d9cd66ef864f33feb38de4dd3e4da41

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/what-science-says-and-doesn-t-about-spanking/

attributes.action: Stop the practice of charging self funding OAPs higher care rates than councils
attributes.background: Self funding residential care or nursing pensioners subsidise the fees for  council patients by hundreds of pounds per week for exactly the same care. All fees should be transparent and equal for all clients. Councils must pay more, private funders should pay the equivalent rate to ensure fairness.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Times Article:
https://www.ft.com/content/6c61fa30-f1dc-11e6-8758-6876151821a6

AGE UK report:
https://www.ageuk.org.uk/Documents/EN-GB/Press%20releases/behind_the_headlines_care_homes_oct2016.pdf?dtrk=true

Express Article:
https://www.express.co.uk/comment/expresscomment/723552/Wrong-sensible-savers-to-subsidise-care-elderly-old-age-saving-self-funding

attributes.action: Govt to increase funding for UK space programme, launch technology and spaceport
attributes.background: With the recent successful launch of the Electron rocket, developed in and launched from New Zealand, the UK is at risk of being left behind in the development of space tech. This petition calls on the Government to expedite and properly fund UK space ambitions including Skylon and a UK spaceport.
attributes.additional_details:
-UK Space Agency funding for 2016/17 was £371 million which is 0.05% of £772 billion total govt spending in the same year.
-Small nation of New Zealand successfully developed Electron rocket satellite launcher.
-Spin-off technologies associated with space programmes will benefit UK economy with high-tech jobs.
-21st century race for low-cost launchers, UK at risk of being left behind by other countries.

attributes.action: To alter the trade description act so as to include new build homes
attributes.background: We would like tighter regulations in statute to enforce what is sold off plan and what is built. This should include updated quantifiable building standards with fixed time limits to rectify issue / problems with new builds. This will be enforced by daily fines, similar to over runs on the railways
attributes.additional_details: There is a ground swell of people who have been and still are facing unfair treatment due to wholly or outdated regulations. It is time UK law supported UK people not large companies.

attributes.action: Make companies prove they are complying with equality laws
attributes.background:
Iceland recently became the first country in the world to make companies prove they are not paying women less than men for the same work. 

This year, the 100th anniversary of women's right to vote, is a perfect time for the UK to strengthen its own equality laws.
attributes.additional_details:
In Iceland, companies and government agencies with more than 25 staff must now obtain government certification of their equal pay policies.

In light of recent debate around the gender pay gap in the UK, including the resignation of BBC's Carrie Gracie, this would be an important step towards ensuring that equality laws are being complied with.

Since workers rarely know what their colleagues are getting paid, it is all too easy for employers to get away with paying unfair wages.

attributes.action: Introduce Suicide Bereavement Support to the NHS Services
attributes.background: We want more services and support for Suicide Bereavement via NHS Services. Currently, there is no such service and people are likely to be referred to bereavement counselling or SOBS. Suicide is on the rise, those of us who have been bereaved in this way struggle to find support or support groups.
attributes.additional_details:
My brother committed suicide in May 2016, it left everybody devastated and changed our lives forever and in unimaginable ways.  Unable to find help with her doctor, my Mum found a SOBS group in her region, however, the meetings are once a month and the group in this region has since closed.  Who else can my Mum and others affected talk to?

Suicide bereavement is something you will never understand until you have experienced it, as said, it’s life changing and you are left isolated with so many thoughts and emotions to cope with.

We have started a Facebook Group for Suicide Bereavement UK and every new person that joins have not been able to find the right support and can be left feeling suicidal themselves.

attributes.action: British Citizens must given the same rights as European citizens in the UK
attributes.background: ECJ human rights law must apply equally to EU Citizens and British citizens after March 2019. We can not allow a situation where British Citizens or European citizens living in the UK are treated as second class citizens after March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
Brussels is pushing for the European Court of Justice to have a role in EU citizens' rights for 15 years after Brexit.

https://news.sky.com/story/ecj-role-at-heart-of-may-juncker-lunch-disagreement-11158741

Tory Brexiters set new red lines over ECJ and free movement

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/dec/03/tory-brexiters-set-new-red-lines-over-ecj-and-free-movement

Theresa May says UK leaving EU court's jurisdiction

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41012265

attributes.action: Make the Treasury remove the VAT on fuel duty
attributes.background: If you buy fuel at £1.229 per litre, petrol or diesel, are you aware that 11.59 pence of the total VAT on the fuel you purchase is actually a tax upon the fuel duty, which is also a government tax on fuel!!!
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT on the fuel duty is removed, then the £1.229p cost of fuel will reduce to £1.02p!!!!

attributes.action: Make illegal all cold calling telemarketing calls to UK phone numbers
attributes.background:
Almost all British Citizens have mobile phones near us at all times, and increasingly less control over who has our phone number

Unscrupulous companies call without prior permission, at any time of day or night, in order to sell us unwanted products or services. This behaviour should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details:
Telemarketing has existed in for almost as long as there have been telephones. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemarketing

In 2017, 94% of UK adults owned at least one mobile, and there were 26.4m landlines in the UK. Ofcom: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/latest/media/facts

In 2014, 58% of surveyed companies used telemarketing to generate customer sales. dma.org: https://dma.org.uk/press-release/new-telemarketing-research-reveals-it-s-good-to-talk

In 2013, 85% of householders said they'd received a nuisance call on their landline, 17% complained. thisismoney.co.uk: http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/news/article-2377639/Watchdog-launches-online-tool-reporting-nuisance-calls-texts.html

attributes.action: Issue an RAF centenary medal to all serving RAF personnel.
attributes.background: The RAF celebrates its centenary year in 2018 and given its illustrious past and its continued contribution to the safety and security of the United Kingdom, a centenary medal should be issued to all serving members of the RAF who achieve permanent service within the Royal Air Force during 2018.

attributes.action: Stop including student loans as “income” for benefits calculations
attributes.background:
We are calling upon the government to stop penalising those who are committed to making themselves more employable by studying for Higher Education qualifications.

A student loan must be paid back (with interest). It is not a grant - and therefore should not be considered as income.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently in the UK, those in receipt of a student loan have it included as “income” when benefits are calculated, and it can affect their entitlement.

Part-time students are particularly at risk; should they find themselves temporarily unable to work, they may not be eligible for the same financial assistance as another person in exactly the same position as them who is not in part-time study.

For more information on benefits that are affected by student loan: https://www.turn2us.org.uk/Benefit-guides/Student-Support/How-does-student-support-affect-benefits

attributes.action: Everyone breeding puppies must have a licence linked to the puppy's microchip.
attributes.background: Dog breeders must all obtain a licence to breed. All litters and puppies should be listed onto a national database. All puppies must carry the licence details linked to their chip. No puppy should be sold without a chip, a licence certificate and a national database number.
attributes.additional_details: If this system were introduced then linked to a (heavily reformed) Dangerous Dogs Act and a health monitoring system, breeders who persistently bred litters with poor temperaments or health problems could be identified and have their licences revoked. In one fell swoop this would put puppy farmers out of business almost overnight, help to solve the problem of health defects being bred into or promoted in some breeds and improve the quality and temperament of puppies for family pet homes.

attributes.action: Hold Referendum in Scotland, to end devolution and return control to Westminster
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the Scottish government, ruining Scotland's economy and creating severe division in the populace, there is an increasing opinion that the welfare of the Scottish people could be better served by the Westminster Government.

attributes.action: Relegalise the possession of fresh (unprepared) psilocybin ('magic') mushrooms.
attributes.background:
Psilocybin mushrooms have thousands of years of recorded human use. Studies indicate that they help sufferers of mental illness, depression, anxiety and many other medical conditions.

They are also used in many spiritual and religious practices and remain legal around the world.
attributes.additional_details:
Psilocybin mushrooms are non-toxic, are not addictive and have not been shown to have any detrimental effect on long-term mental health they grow naturally within the UK and continue to be sold legally in the Netherlands with no adverse consequences.

They have significant potential as medicines, with psilocybin being investigated as a treatment for depression, anxiety, addiction and PTSD. Research shows that just a single dose of psilocybin lifts anxiety and depression for six months or longer.

attributes.action: Higher the tax free amount from £11500 to £15000
attributes.background: The Average family who works is struggling to make ends meet due to them being taxed. The inflation to normal living goes up every year but yet the tax free amount remains the same at £11,500 when the average family needs to earn £15,000 a year to survive and remain off benifits.
attributes.additional_details:
£11,500 a year Is tax free which at this rate it equals roughly £958 a month. An average family will need to earn £288 a week to meet basic demands of live, if we was multiple this by 52 weeks it equals £15,000 which should be tax free.

The tax on the living is making it harder for families to make ends meet families are being forced to be on benefits which then this is making it harder for the working class. 

So if the tax free amount was higher this will help more people being able to live.

attributes.action: Change the NHS guidelines asking people their sexual orientation
attributes.background:
In April of 2019 the NHS guidelines will be changed requiring nurses and doctors etc to ask people their sexual orientation no matter what their appointment is about. 

This is wrong as it is personal information and should only be needed if required. Please don’t let this happen.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine the will of the people for NHS and care funding.
attributes.background: Reports by respected institutions such as the IFS, OBR and Nuffield Trust indicate that NHS funding per person is budgeted to fall and that future spending needs to rise to meet patient demand. Despite this, the Government refuses to increase funding even to match that of other wealthy countries.
attributes.additional_details: To remove politics as far as possible, hold a UK referendum on whether to establish an independent Commission to decide how to fund both the NHS and social care or leave it to Governments to decide. Voters would be choosing between continuing as now or having an independent Commission to set strategic funding plans, based upon need and not ideology, for Governments follow.

attributes.action: Make beating a horse an offence as it is for all other animals.
attributes.background: Beating any animal viciously is an offence in the UK except for horses ie as in racing.  Why are horses an exception?

attributes.action: Put a Tax on all excessive packaging Including plastic and cardboard.
attributes.background: Most packaging that is being used in supermarkets is only a quarter to half full of the product. This is to make you think that you’re buying more than you’re getting. (Cardboard box) We have received a item no bigger than 5 x 4 Inches, but the box it came in was roughly 18 x12 x14 Inches.
attributes.additional_details: All companies to use no more than 10% of the packaging that is required for packing of the product.

attributes.action: Introduce specialist funds for councils to tackle littering and fly-tipping
attributes.background: In recent times, cash-strapped councils have had to find ways to reduce their costs. One of the main areas to suffer during these cutbacks has been litter collections and resources to fight littering and fly-tipping. The problem has become endemic across the country and funds are needed to tackle it
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/3339655/Litter-and-fly-tipping-facts.html
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/773905/Flytippers-and-litterbugs-cost-England-1billion-a-year
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-publishes-new-anti-littering-strategy
http://www.zerowastescotland.org.uk/litter-flytipping/national-strategy
http://gov.wales/topics/environmentcountryside/epq/cleanneighbour/litter1/?lang=en

attributes.action: Make Alzheimer’s/Dementia care completely funded by the NHS.
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Demand an apology and a retraction of Trump's interference in British politics.
attributes.background: President Trump has given comfort to a far right, violent, British political party by re-tweeting their racist lies. Our government should summon the US Ambassador to inform him that interference in British politics in unacceptable and to demand an apology and a retraction.
attributes.additional_details: See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42166663

attributes.action: Conjugal Visits Allowed In The UK To Stop Reoffending.
attributes.background: In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.
attributes.additional_details: The Howard League released a report where it explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe. Lorraine Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper who visited Halden prison in Norway in 2014, where conjugal visits are allowed. As a result, Norway has one of the lowest reoffending rates in the world, currently standing at 20%. In comparison, 59% of British prisoners reoffend within a year of being released.

attributes.action: For Student Finance England to acknowledge their mistakes with payment errors!
attributes.background: In March 2018 2nd / 3rd year nursing & health care students from  universities in the UK were informed Student Finance England had mistakenly overpaid them and consequently blocked any further payments. We are aware the number of students affected is growing and could now have reached over 1000.
attributes.additional_details:
Students clarified their payment total but were reassured this was correct. Immediate payments are being demanded by SFE and have left students leaving their course due to financial pressures and is affecting the emotional wellbeing of students.

We would like: 
A public apology from SFE

To have repayment plans based on individuals circumstances

To cut interest charges on overpayments as compensation for distress

Financial support for 2nd year students to continue their training

attributes.action: Increase highway maintenance funding to make the roads safe to use
attributes.background: Across the country, roads are in a dangerous state of disrepair. Many signs are dirty, broken or obscured by foliage. Road surfaces are badly potholed. It's likely that this neglect has contributed to deaths and injury. Clearly highway maintenance urgently requires a significant increase in funding.
